nodes.bodyText:
[nit]
Just throw the new exception instead of storing it as a variable first.
This is a breaking change. This functionality exists in the current implementation. If you plan to do this in separate PR, add a sim task for it, so it is not missed.
Remove this comment @awszztt since it is no longer disabled.
We need equivalent of this code in the new client.

I put a similar part of code into the function of "postInject()". The real change I made to there lines is to move out the code inside executorService.submit(() -> { } and then remove the executorService. Do you mean the executorService is required?

No, the key difference is that this is in onConnectionResumed so when the internet connection comes back it will try sending updates again. We could add this callback to our MQTT client and then this should work again.

I saw there is a callback blocks - onConnectionResumed - in the AwsIotMqttClient, in which all the subscriptions would be resubscribed. If this callback session is added, will it do some duplicate work?
No, this isn't duplicate (as long as you don't do the resubscribe). What is somewhat duplicated is the re-publish, but this will only be a duplicate once we actually have the cloud spooler.
Do both TimeoutException blocks need to exist? Sync with michael on this, he said both are possible.
I do not think we need the fake config. Read the comment above about using the connection in the AwsIotMqttClient

Why does this need to extend MqttClientConnection? I believe you need MqttClientConnection to initialize the iotJobsHelper.
The MqttClient has a list of AwsIotMqttClient which represents the connection. So can you get that connection to initialize the JobHelper? This way you can avoid initializing fake config for the connection.

It is needed to fake it out because they don't support an interface. I opened a PR on them to use an interface instead, but they haven't reviewed it yet.
We can't just give it a real connection because it will be creating subscriptions and publishing messages outside of our control. This means that we won't know when there are too many subscriptions, and it won't work with cloud spooler.
You can use the connection represented by the MqttClient in this wrapper for initializing the jobsHelper

From my understanding, A Mqtt client is a manger to control multiple AwsIotMqttClient and a single AwsIotMqttClient is a MqttConnection. It is hard to use a specific connection for the IotJobsClient here.
Each WrapperMqttClientConnection instance has exactly one MqttClient. All the works should be managed by the MqttClient. The MqttClient would provide the specific connection that the IotJobsClient needs.
You must not remove this.
Added it back
Your recent changes should fix this test, please undo this change.
I will remove the comment label here.
Remove everything in this callback. It isn't doing anything useful.
Done.
Remove this log, the real callback already logs this information.
Done.
This needs to be a set because we need to support more than 1 callback
Done.

Rename this. It should not be specific to deployment.
Also, take the sessionPresent as a parameter to this method, not as a field of the class.
Done both.
Do not check for all connected. If one connection is back, they all are, even if they don't realize it yet.
Remove the isAllConnectionConnected in either MqttClient.call or the CallbackEventManager.
Remove it from both. You don't need it as a condition, you can just use the Boolean that you already have.
There is a new commit that just use the boolean "hasCallBacked". dfae16c
This should not be set here. It need to be set  by onConnectionInterrupted.
Set the hasCallBacked from in the onConnectionInterrupted.
Remove commented out code
I don't think you really need this comment at all. If you want to keep it, I'd recommend just saying that this method isn't needed in this use case.
Should not be public
Why are you doing this? The callbacks do not belong to these clients, the callbacks are global.
I was wondering, if the previous one is not removed, the same global callback would be added to the callbackManager n times (n is the number of AwsIotMqttClient)
There does need to be 1 callback per client though to properly handle errors and reconnection.
This must not be a field. It need to be a parameter of the callback.
The way to proper use this is to use compare And Set. You want to compare to false and set to true only if it was false.
Now that you're using atomic boolean, these don't need to be synchronized.
All these fields should be private.

This is not what I would do. Go back to what you had before. Keep the callbacks as normal in the aws IoT client and then call this method in the callback manager from the callback defined in the IoT client.
A builder is really unnecessary. You can just create the atomic boolean in the field declaration.
No * imports. Please use the intellij.xml file in the code style directory to apply our coding style to your intellij environment.
I wouldn't do it this way, instead go back to how you had it before and just have the callback defined in this class call the callback manager.
Rename this to add because it isn't setting but adding.
this check needs to go outside of the for loop, otherwise only the first one will be called, which isn't correct.
same here, this check needs to go outside of the for loop so that it calls all of the callbacks
Good catch! I have corrected this part and submitted a new commit.
what warning is being suppressed? Get rid of the warning if we can.
Can you please move this log line up to the top of this method, so that the first thing it does is log.
ok.
get rid of this comment.
still applies.
change to CopyOnWriteSet.
might want to use Inject here instead of directly creating it so tat we can mock it easier. Up to you.
does this need a getter?
Yes.  The callbackconnectionEvents itself is private and could be retrieved from the Test. Thus, I followed the pattern from IotJobsHelper file and add @getter to it.
Use @Getter(AccessLevel.Package) so that it stays somewhat private.
add the copyright header to your IntelliJ settings.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,85 +1,113 @@
-/*
- * Copyright Amazon.com Inc. or its affiliates.
- * SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
- */

nodes.bodyText: Do not remove these extensions. Without them, the test will not work.
can you move this even before the resubscribe?
what is this file doing here? I think you did a bad merge.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,120 @@
+/* Copyright Amazon.com, Inc. or its affiliates. All Rights Reserved.

nodes.bodyText: this comment doesn't seem very necessary.
